comment: This was a great intro class! She gives so many extra credit points for cultural pop culture that there's no way to fail this class. Tests are online and open book and there's one large essay at the end of the semester. Attendance is not mandatory but if you skip you miss the bonus point opportunities. Very dry lectures, super nice lady.

This class very easy, only two tests, and two projects. There was weekly work, but it was all pretty easy. She's such a nice professor and is easy to have a conversation with. I would definitely recommend taking this class.

This professor was a very kind women and her lectures would be interesting. Although when it comes to grading she is very slow. There is a 6-10 page paper near the end of the semester that felt like it was sprung on the class last minute. Other than the paper her class was easy to manage!

Professor Wallsmith grades assignments slowly, loses work often, and does not answer questions in a timely manner. Her lectures do not relate to the course material covered in your assigned book nor are they helpful when it comes to the tests and quizzes she assigns, which are 100 questions. Furthermore, she does not explain projects well.

Don't do it. Just save yourself the trouble. She never responds to emails, doesn't know how to use D2L and assigns RIDICULOUSLY hard assignments for an intro course and then gives us LITERALLY NO DIRECTION WHATSOEVER. She's awful. Seriously, I'm an A student and she's the WORST.

Very sweet but was an awful professor. She never responds to emails and never takes responsibility for things that were her fault. Only two exams that are impossible without Quizlet, a family tree, and movie ethnography. Only 200 points total. She offers bonus points randomly for showing up to class and answering questions. Don't take her
rating_tags: Graded by few things--EXTRA CREDIT--Tough grader

comment: She was an awful professor. She doesn't know how to use D2L, is incapable of getting things graded on time, gives almost no direction for assignments, and gets mad at students for things that are her fault. Do yourself a favor and skip this professor.

She's probably a good in class instructor based on other reviews here, but she sucks online. She had no idea how to use d2l. Gave almost no instruction on the 2 projects at the end of the semester that counted for most of our grade then graded ridiculously. Constantly behind on grading.

DO NOT take her online class. Doesnt ever respond to emails so your questions never get answered. Weekly quizzes/vocabulary activities, two tests, a project and a 6 page paper. The paper is 20% of your grade, the movie choice is not good at all for what she wants you to write the paper on, and there are almost no instruction for it. Very judgmental

Very sweet woman. I showed up most days to do the attendance thing but I never paid attention in lecture. She knows what she's talking about and is easy to crack jokes with. Very laid back atmosphere and I thoroughly enjoyed my time. Not very demanding but there are only two tests and it is a LOT of material to cover (I recommend quizlet).
If you have the opportunity to take her I highly recommend it. She is super sweet and really wants her students to do well.

She was really nice. Attendance to class not mandatory but she gives extra credit once in awhile so it pays to show up. Only 2 exams, 1 family tree, and 1 movie review for total grade which put alot of pressure on them. She read from PPT slides but still found a way to keep it interesting. Great personality, I would definitely take her again.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Attendance isn't mandatory but she gives extra credit every once and awhile, so it's best to show up. She's nice and knows her stuff but the class is boring. The two test are vocab heavy so you have to study. She grades the paper as if you're already an anthropologist and it's worth half your grade so you better take it to the writing center.

Pretty straightforward class, two tests and a paper about a movie.  Attendance isn't tracked. She's very monotone though & the class can be extremely boring, she reads straight from the ppt and she posts those online also.

Although attendance isn't mandatory or tracked, definitely go! She does cultural pop culture extra credit opportunities randomly throughout the semester. This bumped up my 89. She knows her stuff and has done some cool things in the past. Frequently let us out early.

Going to class is not necessary, attendance isnt taken  The only time that you have to go to class is during group discussions and group presentations, which is about 2 weeks out of the semester. She is a tough grader on the paper you have to write. Needs to be written from an anthropological pov. If you take it to the writing center youll be good.

My biggest warning is for papers: she has high expectations that must follow an anthropological point of view AND must be professionally written. Get a friend that has previously taken Anthropology courses to help with papers, then take your paper to the Writing Center. Otherwise, it's an easily passable course.

Professor Wallsmith is awesome. She does not expect you to be an anthropology expert. She just wants to spark interest and hopes you take away something from the class. Do all of your assignments and you will be fine.

Very easy to zone out in this class because Professor Wallsmith is a little monotone. However, I did enjoy this class. Very easy with 2 tests and 2 papers. She posts all the Powerpoints online but  should still come to class because she does these things called cultural pop culture and you don't know when she is going to give them. Good professor.

Professor Wallsmith is great. She really knows her subject matter and being in her class is delightful. She is a hard grader on written assignments, but the tests are easy. She offers extra credit opportunities if you attend class. I may not have gotten an A, but at least I received a higher level of education and satisfaction than in other classes

I absolutely loved this class and I loved Ms. Wallsmith. She is delightful in all respects! Class was easy for me. I definitely recommend. She is awesome and she is so intelligent but by no means is she arrogant. TAKE HER CLASS

Dr. Wallsmith was a very good professor. The topics we researched were interesting, and she was often clear on the guidelines. I enjoyed taking this class. Also, there was no textbook needed and she posts the powerpoints online. Attendance is not mandatory, but I'd strongly recommend it.

This class is not an easy A, but not very hard. You do have to put some effort into her class. She reads off the power points and posts them online.  She can be a bit confusing at times and not very clear when it comes to what she is looking for in terms of papers and projects. Attendance is not mandatory. You do not need the book.

Pretty easy class. I worked relatively hard and got an A. The main grade for the class comes from a presentation and a paper. Really good teacher. Definitely the best choice for a class for that particular area in kennesaw's curriculum requirements.

I was not excited about this class at all. I started off the semester very slow. Class attendance is not mandatory, but recommended. Dr. Wallsmith will give VALUABLE information regarding tests if you are there. Really, really study the book and go over power points. Dr. Wallsmith is very fair and knows her subject well.

She was terrific. The material is super exciting but it is interesting.  Get the BOOK and study the VOCAB! On the first test I didn't focus on the vocab and got a low B, on the final I just studied the vocab and got an A+. She puts everything on vista including her slideshows. If you find studying vocab easy then this is an easy A.

Take her. You will have to read the material and showing up to class will probably make a letter grade of difference. But very nice, entertaining and helpful. PS: don't wait until the last minute to choose a debate topic. Female Genital Mutilation might be what's left.

She is very well travelled and has worked on some cool projects, but despite this she was almost boring. However, she grades fairly and her tests were pretty easy. Enjoyed the class debates, but she didn't make the subject fun or exciting.
This lady is awesome! She is well traveled, has a great sense of humor and is very flexible. Take her!

Wonderful professor! She can be a bit monotonous at times, but overall she is clear, knows her stuff, and funny. Attendance is not mandatory and not much book use. Pay attention, take notes, doe the projects, and you'll be fine! Would definitely recommend Dr. Wallsmith.
Great teacher! Will really help you out if you have any problems. Tests are easy and final and midterm are very manageable. I definitely recommend taking this Prof.
Super easy, enjoyed the class. Very helpful and not harsh at all. Happy to help her students.

Awesome teacher, super easy class! Not demanding and not aggressive. She didn't ever care about using technologies in class and wasn't strict on due dates. Very helpful, and I'd take her class again in a heartbeat.

Took this class online. It was interesting, but not as much as I was expecting. Got a B with a lot of work put in and I'm normally an A student. She is nice and helped me out a lot, but I wish I hadn't taken this class online.
Fantastic!!!  she was clear and precise,  makes me consider a major's change into this field...hmm.....
Very easy! 3 tests... one over articles in the textbook (she tells you which ones)... tests two and three are the SAME format. Easy A!

She's very nice and extremely experienced in archaeology; she brings artifacts to class for extra credit identification. Notes are clear, book is a good back up - know the terms and the "related info" blurbs (test E.C. comes from these and E.C. is worth more than the actual test questions). Read the book, turn stuff in on time, and it's an easy A.

Great professor! Lectures are interesting and engaging. Feel free to speak up with you opinion. She's a very accomplished archeologist and anthropologist and has worked all over the world. Test are around 60 questions and are worded very clearly. As long as you study a little bit you'll do fine.

Great professor! Make sure you buy the book (like $10) because that is all that test one is on. The rest of the class all you have to do give a debate over a topic. The test are very easy as long as you know the summaries for each side in each debate (which can be found online). Would definitely take her again!
